channel.title: How To Change:
channel.description: So i needed help changing the log in and out. when someone logs in it says (name here) has logged in. when someone logs out it says (name here) has logged in. i want to change the last one to logged out. please help. :cool:

item.title: How To Change:
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

oh lmao here we go.

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Mager pk")){ yell("Mager pk has Logged in."); if(server.npcHandler.npcs[i] != null) { server.npcHandler.npcs[i].updateRequired = true; server.npcHandler.npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; server.npcHandler.npcs[i].textUpdate = "mager pk has Logged in"; } }

item.title: How To Change:
item.dc:creator: @Jays Jays
item.description:
@Jays wrote:

Nope, its 100% client sided because you have to play the game on a client first of all. Every client you play on has that playerName logged in/out feature developed via the client’s side. I promise to you its in EVERY client you download anywhere, it’s a small chance that you’ll see it’s server sided though.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Change:
item.dc:creator: @cows1471 cows1471
item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

It depends. does it happen with EVERY server source?

if not then its server sided, otherwise ur right

Read full topic

item.title: How To Change:
item.dc:creator: @Jays Jays
item.description:
@Jays wrote:

[quote=“cows1471, post:5, topic:304792”][quote author=Jays link=topic=401071.msg2973132#msg2973132 date=1254079298]
Dude this is client side, I assume you’ve never done this before. Search for method77(s7 + " has logged out.", 5, “”, aBoolean991); in the client.java of your client’s directory. You should see something like this:

if(anIntArray826[k24] != i18) { anIntArray826[k24] = i18; aBoolean1153 = true; if(i18 > 1) method77(s7 + " has logged in.", 5, "", aBoolean991); else if(i18 == 1) method77(s7 + " has logged out.", 5, "", aBoolean991); }
[/quote]

I thoroughly disagree, if this is being printed in onto the dialouge chat box, it would be somthing like this:

+getplayername+ has just logged in![/quote]

No, it is assigned as s7 because of the decompiler. The decompiler assigns all members of the same name distinctly with default values, which is a reason why we have method[b]77/b to method[b]178/b… hence that it method is incremented by the decompiler if that method’s distinct value already exists. So s7 is a distinct member in the client.java. The person who originally decompiled the client (the original version) before didn’t have any control of it’s setup.

I just searched s7 myself and see that it consist of method587() in the class50.java file:

[code] public static String method587(int i, String s)
{
if(i != -45804)
anInt817 = -410;
if(s.length() > 0)
{
char ac[] = s.toCharArray();
for(int j = 0; j < ac.length; j++)
if(ac[j] == ‘_’)
{
ac[j] = ’ ';
if(j + 1 < ac.length && ac[j + 1] >= ‘a’ && ac[j + 1] <= ‘z’)
ac[j + 1] = (char)((ac[j + 1] + 65) - 97);
}

        if(ac[0] >= 'a' && ac[0] <= 'z')
            ac[0] = (char)((ac[0] + 65) - 97);
        return new String(ac);
    } else
    {
        return s;
    }
}[/code]

So it’s client sided.

Read full topic

if(anIntArray826[k24] != i18) { anIntArray826[k24] = i18; aBoolean1153 = true; if(i18 > 1) method77(s7 + " has logged in.", 5, "", aBoolean991); else if(i18 == 1) method77(s7 + " has logged out.", 5, "", aBoolean991); }[/quote]

I thoroughly disagree, if this is being printed in onto the dialouge chat box, it would be somthing like this:

+getplayername+ has just logged in!

item.title: How To Change:
item.dc:creator: @Jays Jays
item.description:
@Jays wrote:

Dude this is client side, I assume you’ve never done this before. Search for method77(s7 + " has logged out.", 5, “”, aBoolean991); in the client.java of your client’s directory. You should see something like this:

if(anIntArray826[k24] != i18) { anIntArray826[k24] = i18; aBoolean1153 = true; if(i18 > 1) method77(s7 + " has logged in.", 5, "", aBoolean991); else if(i18 == 1) method77(s7 + " has logged out.", 5, "", aBoolean991); }

Im not exactly sure what method77() does but I know it’s to shout things in your chat box like “Nothing happens.”.

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 27, 2009, 01:24:11 pm[/size][hr][quote=“cows1471, post:3, topic:304792”]search for it in client.java[/quote]

I just did that myself right before i posted this and it didn’t work.
